e4: While there may be short-term repercussions from changing the reporting policy, prioritizing accurate and unbiased financial disclosure is crucial for building long-term trust with investors. This ethical stance will ultimately contribute to a more sustainable and valuable company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is one that prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It provides a clear, unbiased representation of the company's financial performance. While short-term market reactions are a valid concern, they should not outweigh the long-term benefits of building trust with investors through honest and complete reporting. Ideally, such a policy would also be consistent and easily understood by all stakeholders.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team to elaborate on their plan for communicating the policy change to investors. How will they address potential market concerns and ensure a smooth transition? Additionally, I'd inquire about  internal controls being put in place to prevent any future reporting bias.
